title: Former N.H. state representative, Tyngsborough daycare worker plead guilty to child exploitation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The two defendants pleaded guilty after they exchanged nude photos of children that one of them had taken at the day care.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A former New Hampshire State Representative and a former employee at a Tyngsborough daycare both pleaded guilty to child exploitation and child pornography charges, prosecutors said.

title: Why Mike Vrabel compared Patriots QB Drake Maye to Hall-of-Fame pitcher
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "I think Josh [McDaniels] and Ashton [Grant] have tried to work hard on that.
I also think Drake is talented.
" Drake Maye has only been knocked for five interceptions so far this year.

author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "I'm just worried about what people in our organization think, and worry about we think and what my teammates think.
" Drake Maye AP Photo/Greg M.
Cooper Former Patriots quarterback Cam Newton is skeptical about the staying power of the Patriots’ winning success.

title: Cyclist killed, driver facing charges in Framingham hit and run, prosecutors say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The fatal hit and run happened Wednesday morning when a man in a vehicle allegedly struck and killed a bicyclist.
A Framingham man was arrested and charged Wednesday after he allegedly hit and killed a bicyclist with his vehicle, according to prosecutors.
Paulo Castro, 69, of Framingham, is charged with leaving the scene of personal injury causing death, the Middlesex District Attorney’s Office said in a press release.

title: Dustin Pedroia gives his take on how Rafael Devers, Red Sox handled drama before trade
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Red Sox "For me, I would love to see Raffy finish his career as a Red Sox and have that smile on his face and hit 30 home runs for 20 years.
" Dustin Pedroia is upset that Rafael Devers' career shifted to San Francisco.
Jim Davis/The Boston Globe ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Sperm whale carcass that washed up on Nantucket ‘far too big’ to be removed from beach
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The carcass of the endangered whale washed up on a Nantucket beach earlier this week and weighs more than 100,000 pounds.
A dead sperm whale washed up on Nantucket’s north shore Sunday, and marine officials have decided that it will not be removed due to its weight.

Marine Mammal Alliance Nantucket (MMAN), a volunteer non-profit organization dedicated to rescuing and protecting marine mammals on the island, determined that the roughly 50-foot male weighs approximately 52 tons, or 104,000 pounds, the organization said in a Facebook post.
